info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:48PM CDT until May 14 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR EASTERN NEWTON COUNTY... At 348 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Jasper, moving south at 10 mph. This storm has a history of producing up to quarter size hail, most recently in and near Jasper. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jasper... Piercetown... Carver... Erbie... Pruitt... Bass... Wayton... Marble Falls... Crossroad... Vendor... Parthenon... Gum Springs in Newton County... Mt Judea... Deer... Hasty... Mt Sherman... Cowell... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
